channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for RI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for RI

item.title: Report E-2024060002
item.description:
Report E-2024060002

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-07
  • City: WEST WARWICK
  • State: RI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNIVAR SOLUTIONS USA INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver was delivering Caustic Soda 50% Diaphram to a customer in West Warwick RI on Tuesday morning 5/7/24. Univar Solutions' Driver called dispatch on arrival to customer to report a small release. Driver reported the gasket was pinched on the dome manway which allowed product into the spill box of trailer. Driver backed into the unloading area and noticed a trail of caustic drips leading down the pavement into customer's unloading area. Driver pulled the trailer out of the pitched area to refasten the dome gasket. Driver got the customer's employee to review the release. Customer personnel cleaned up the drips with rags and water. An incident report was filled out and signed by customer. Further investigation indicated the air valve was open on the trailer and Driver did not conduct a thorough pre trip on the trailer catching the open air valve. The released product at the customer was a result of the open air valve and not the dome gasket.
